com.myronmarston.music.notation
Class NotationElementList

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<NotationElement>
              com.myronmarston.music.notation.NotationElementList
All Implemented Interfaces:
NotationElement, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<NotationElement>, java.util.Collection<NotationElement>, java.util.List<NotationElement>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class NotationElementList
extends java.util.ArrayList<NotationElement>
implements NotationElement

A list of notation elements. This is intended to be used for a list of notes, but can be used for any list of notation elements.

See Also:
Serialized Form

scaleDurations

public void scaleDurations(long scaleFactor)
                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Scales the durations by the given scale factor. Each duration is multiplied by it.

Specified by:
scaleDurations in interface NotationElement
Parameters:
scaleFactor - the scale factor; should be a power of 2
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this list has no elements that support duration scaling

supportsDurationScaling

Indicates whether or not this list supports duration scaling.

Returns:

getNotationNotes

public java.util.List<NotationNote> getNotationNotes()
Gets a list of notation notes from owned by this list. This combines and collapses all nested lists into a single list.

Specified by:
getNotationNotes in interface NotationElement
Returns:
list of notation notes owned by this list

totalDurationDenomAddsToPowerOf2

public static boolean totalDurationDenomAddsToPowerOf2(java.util.Collection<NotationElement> elements)
Checks to see if the sum total of the denominators of all the durations is a power of 2.

Parameters:
elements - the list of elements to check
Returns:
true if the sum total of all the duration denominators is a power of 2

removeConsecutiveNotesWhoseDenomsAddToPowerOf2

public void removeConsecutiveNotesWhoseDenomsAddToPowerOf2()
Removes individual notes, or groups of consecutive notes, with duration denominators that are a power of 2. This will leave notes with abnormal durations.

getEndIndexForTupletGroup

public int getEndIndexForTupletGroup(int beginIndex)
Finds the end index that should be used to create a tuplet collection. Beginning with the given beginIndex, the durations are summed until the denominator is a power of two. The notes between these two indices should be part of the same tuplet group.

Parameters:
beginIndex - the index the tuplet group to begins from
Returns:
the index the tuplet group ends at

getSmallestNoteDurationDenominator

public long getSmallestNoteDurationDenominator()
                                        throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Gets the smallest note duration denominator in this list.

Returns:
the smallest note duration denominator
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the list does not have any notes

groupTuplets

public void groupTuplets()
Searches the list for any notes that should be grouped as a tuplet and wraps them in a Tuplet.
